meaning: Kneeling on a washboard (Husband being punished by wife)
description: Literally "kneeling on a washboard". It's a metaphor for a husband being severely scolded or punished by his wife. It implies that simply kneeling (bowing/apologizing) isn't enough, so he's made to kneel on a rough washboard as further punishment.

examples.chinese: 突然想起来今天老婆的生日,差一点就要跪搓衣板了
examples.translation: Suddenly remembered today is my wife's birthday, I was almost about to kneel on the washboard.

examples.chinese: 在外面千万别帮助别的女生,这不怕回家跪搓衣板吗
examples.translation: Never help other girls when you are outside, aren't you afraid of kneeling on the washboard when you get home?

examples.chinese: 在外面一定要给男人面子,回来让他跪搓衣板都可以
examples.translation: You must give men face (respect) when outside; when you get back, you can make him kneel on the washboard.
